AWSALBTGCORS.description: AWS Application Load Balancer Cookie: This load-balancing cookie is managed by AWS and is for Weighted Target Groups associated with cross-origin resource sharing (CORS) requests. With CORS requests, some browsers require SameSite=None; Secure to enable stickiness. In this case, the elastic load balancer generates a second stickiness cookie, AWSALBCORS, which includes the same information as the original stickiness cookie, AWSALBTG, plus the SameSite attribute. Clients receive both cookies in response.

AWSALBTG.description: AWS Application Load Balancer Cookie: The ASWALBTG cookie is a load balancer-generated cookie for Weighted Target Groups. It is used to honor sticky sessions and enable target group stickiness. When the load balancer first routes a request to a weighted target group, it generates an encrypted cookie named AWSALBTG that encodes information about the selected target group and includes the cookie in the response to the client. When the load balancer receives a request from the same client that matches a rule with target group stickiness enabled and contains the cookie, the request is routed to the target group specified in the cookie.

PHPSESSID.description: The PHPSESSID cookie is native to PHP and enables websites to store serialised state data. It is used to establish a user session and to pass state data via a temporary cookie, which is commonly referred to as a session cookie. (expires when you close your browser).

__cf_bm.description: The cookie is a necessary cookie set by Cloudflare to support its Bot Management feature, which is currently in private beta.

_cfuvid.description: This cookie is a part of the services provided by Cloudflare - Including load-balancing, deliverance of website content and serving DNS connection for website operators.

SID.description: SID and HSID cookies contain information about a user's Google account ID and the last login time, which are digitally signed and encrypted. These cookies help Google to prevent many types of attacks, such as attempts to steal the content of forms submitted by the user in Google services

__Secure-1PSIDCC.description: This cookie is set by Google and is used to protect users' data from unauthorized access.

__Secure-1PSIDTS.description: This cookie is set by Google and is used to authenticate users, store session preferences, and perform security measures.

OptanonConsent.description: This cookie is set by the cookie compliance solution from OneTrust. It stores information about the categories of cookies the site uses and whether visitors have given or withdrawn consent for the use of each category. This enables site owners to prevent cookies in each category from being set in the user’s browser, when consent is not given. The cookie has a normal lifespan of one year, so that returning visitors to the site will have their preferences remembered. It contains no information that can identify the site visitor.

abm_leadsource.description: Determine if the page needs to prioritize processing ABM lead sources.

ad_time.description: The time users arrive at the official website through advertisements.

esign_salesforce.description: The cookie generated when visiting a specific page is used to identify the source of user-filled forms.

pre_prod_env_id.description: Used to store the backend user ID.

show_ph.description: Show some information when users bind the license.

token_invalid.description: Determine if the user's download link is valid.

use-curr-nav.description: Used for saving the URL of the current page for the user.

nsid.description: Used in connection with the PayPal payment function on the website. The cookie is necessary to enable a secure transaction via PayPal.

org.springframework.web.servlet.i18n.Coo.description: This cookie is set by the provider Infoniqa engage, used for webforms in a website. The cookie stores the language for the application process.

l7_az.description: This cookie is necessary for the PayPal login function on the website.

admin_email.description: Store the email of the backend login user.

__cflb.description: This cookie is used by Cloudflare for load balancing.

m.description: The cookie provide data that helps Stripe fraud systems recognise the patterns of fraudulent actors and stop them prior to making the purchase to help protect our business.

HSID.description: Google uses this cookie for security. It contains digitally signed and encrypted records of a user’s Google account ID and most recent sign-in time. This cookie allows google to block many types of attack, such as attempts to steal the content of forms that you complete on web pages.

__Secure-3PSIDCC.description: This cookie is set by Google and is used to protect users' data from unauthorized access.

traffic_type.description: This cookie is used to record from where the visitor came to the website orginally. This information is used by the website operator to know the efficiency of their marketing.

__stripe_sid.description: Stripe sets this cookie to process payments.

yt-remote-device-id.description: YouTube sets this cookie to store the user's video preferences using embedded YouTube videos.

yt.innertube::requests.description: YouTube sets this cookie to register a unique ID to store data on what videos from YouTube the user has seen.

yt.innertube::nextId.description: YouTube sets this cookie to register a unique ID to store data on what videos from YouTube the user has seen.

CONSENT.description: YouTube sets this cookie via embedded YouTube videos and registers anonymous statistical data.

cookieyes-consent.description: CookieYes sets this cookie to remember users' consent preferences so that their preferences are respected on subsequent visits to this site. It does not collect or store any personal information about the site visitors.

cf_clearance.description: Clearance Cookie stores the proof of challenge passed. It is used to no longer issue a challenge if present. It is required to reach an origin server.

rc::a.description: This cookie is set by the Google recaptcha service to identify bots to protect the website against malicious spam attacks.

AWSALB.description: AWSALB is an application load balancer cookie set by Amazon Web Services to map the session to the target.

AWSALBCORS.description: Amazon Web Services set this cookie for load balancing.

__stripe_mid.description: Stripe is used for credit card payments. Stripe uses a cookie to remember who you are and to enable our website to process payments without storing any credit card information on its our servers.

_vwo_consent.description: This cookie independently tracks the visitor's consent status for VWO to ensure compliance. It can store essential testing campaign data when VWO is partially blocked, allowing for accurate tracking once consent is given.

__cfruid.description: Cloudflare sets this cookie to identify trusted web traffic.

visitorId.description: Allows to understand what companies are visiting our website.

drift_campaign_refresh.description: This is the session identifier token. It is used to tie the visitor on your website with a current website session within the Drift system. This is enables session-specific features, such as popping up a messaging only once during a 30 minute session as to prevent a disruptive experience.

li_gc.description: Linkedin set this cookie for storing visitor's consent regarding using cookies for non-essential purposes.

lidc.description: This cookie is used by linkedIn to store performed actions on their website.

datr.description: The purpose is to identify the web browser used to connect to Facebook, regardless of which user is logged in. This cookie plays a key role in security.

sb.description: Facebook stores information about the browser to improve its security settings.

wd.description: This cookie stores the browser window dimensions and is used by Facebook to optimise the rendering of the page.

_vwo_ssm.description: This cookie is used for testing and is created only on sites that use the HTTP protocol. This is used to check if VWO can create cookies on them, post which this cookie is deleted.

SRM_B.description: Collected user data is specifically adapted to the user or device. The usercan also be followed outside of the loaded website, creating a picture of the visitor's behavior.

driftt_aid.description: This is the anonymous identifier token. It is used to tie the visitor on your website with the profile within the Drift system. This allows Drift to remember the information that this site visitor has provided through the chat on subsequent site visits.

DRIFT_visitCounts.description: Drift sets this cookie to determine the number of visits of the specific visitor.

drift_aid.description: This is the anonymous identifier token. It is used to tie the visitor on your website with the profile within the Drift system. This allows Drift to remember the information that this site visitor has provided through the chat on subsequent site visits.

lang.description: Linkedin set this cookie to set user's preferred language.

_vwo_global_opt_out.description: This cookie is persisted when a visitor opts out of vwo on all websites in a given browser.

CLID.description: Microsoft Clarity set this cookie to store information about how visitors interact with the website. The cookie helps to provide an analysis report. The data collection includes the number of visitors, where they visit the website, and the pages visited.

_clck.description: Microsoft Clarity sets this cookie to retain the browser's Clarity User ID and settings exclusive to that website. This guarantees that actions taken during subsequent visits to the same website will be linked to the same user ID.

_vis_opt_test_cookie.description: This cookie is created to detect if the cookies are enabled on the visitor’s browser or not. It also helps in tracking the number of browser sessions a visitor has gone through. The value of this cookie is always 1

first_landing_page.description: This cookie captures the landing page that user visits at the first time.

session_id.description: This cookie is used to get or set the session id for the current session.

utm_content.description: This cookie is used for storing the session content value if present.

utm_medium.description: This cookie is used to record from where the visitor came to the website orginally. This information is used by the website operator to know the efficiency of their marketing.

utm_term.description: This cookie is used to record from where the visitor came to the website orginally. This information is used by the website operator to know the efficiency of their marketing.

gclid.description: Store a unique identifier for a user or the ad click that brought the user to your site.

last_referrer_page.description: Store the value of the last referral page.

last_path.description: Determine the last browsing path of the user.

last_type_of_visits.description: Determine the last visited category of the user.

_vis_opt_exp_{CAMPAIGNID}_combi.description: This cookie is created when a visitor is chosen for a particular variation for a test. This cookie makes sure that visitors see the same variation when they revisit the page in the future.

_vwo_uuid.description: This cookie generates a unique id for every visitor and is used for the report segmentation feature in VWO, and it also allows you to view data in a more refined manner

s_fid.description: It is a new cookie introduced in 2013 as a 'fallback' visitor identifier where the s_vi cookie normally used for this purpose is blocked. It contains a randomly generated, unique id.

s_ips.description: The cookie is used for measuring a visitor’s scroll activity to see how much of a page they view before moving on to another page.

s_ppv.description: This cookie is associated with Adobe Analytics site tracking and is used to measure a user's scroll activity to see how much of a page they view before moving to another page.

s_tp.description: The cookie is used for measuring a visitor’s scroll activity to see how much of a page they view before moving on to another page.

s_tslv.description: This cookie holds a Unix timestamp of the current time. It is used for time tracking related metrics within Adobe Analytics.

_vis_opt_s.description: This cookie tracks session created for a visitor, i.e., the number of times the browser was closed and reopened.

_vis_opt_exp_{CAMPAIGNID}_ goal_{GOALID.description: This cookie is created when a campaign goal is triggered. This cookie, when created, will always have a value of 1

__eventn_id_UMgI1I6EdF.description: Usermaven sets this cookie to identify unique users and track their interactions for analytics purposes.

_ga.description: Google Analytics sets this cookie to calculate visitor, session and campaign data and track site usage for the site's analytics report. The cookie stores information anonymously and assigns a randomly generated number to recognise unique visitors.

_ga_GY3Z4S6BVL.description: Google Analytics sets this cookie to store and count page views.

SM.description: Used by Microsoft's Clarity analytics service to synchronise the MUID across Microsoft domains.

_hjSession_*.description: Hotjar sets this cookie to ensure data from subsequent visits to the same site is attributed to the same user ID, which persists in the Hotjar User ID, which is unique to that site.

_hjSessionUser_*.description: Hotjar sets this cookie to ensure data from subsequent visits to the same site is attributed to the same user ID, which persists in the Hotjar User ID, which is unique to that site.

utm_campaign_id.description: to store the unique identifier for a marketing campaign.

utm_source.description: The main purpose is to identify where the traffic to the website is coming from.

amplitude_session.description: The amplitude_session cookie stores the start time of the current user session as a Unix‐epoch timestamp in milliseconds. Amplitude’s JavaScript SDK (and integrations like G2’s site) uses this value to group all events sent within that session—so both front-end and back-end events can be stitched together under the same session ID.

events_distinct_id.description: Sets a unique ID for the session. This allows the website to obtain data on visitor behaviour for statistical purposes.

utm_campaign.description: Used to identify which campaign a user engaged with.

_gid.description: This cookie from Google Analytics links your activities on other devices you have previously logged into using your Google account.

datadome.description: Used for both server-side and client-side detection to assess the legitimacy of a request. The cookie's data is encrypted for security and does not contain any personally identifiable information (PII).

_vis_opt_out.description: This cookie indicates that the visitor should not be made part of any campaign.

_vwo.description: This cookie is a jar of all the cookies. It is currently created only for the Safari browser. In the future, it would replace all the cookies. The actual expiry of a cookie doesn’t matter as it stores the expiry of cookies set in it and keeps on expiring them.

pardot.description: The pardot cookie is set while the visitor is logged in as a Pardot user. The cookie indicates an active session and is not used for tracking.

tvid.description: Presents the user with relevant content and advertisement. The service is provided by third-party advertisement hubs, which facilitate real-time bidding for advertisers.

tv_UIDM.description: It's an ad network for a video network owned by Telaria.

CMPS.description: CasaleMedia sets CMPS cookie for anonymous user tracking based on users' website visits to display targeted ads.

CMPRO.description: CasaleMedia sets CMPRO cookie for anonymous usage tracking and targeted advertising.

ANONCHK.description: The ANONCHK cookie, set by Bing, is used to store a user's session ID and verify ads' clicks on the Bing search engine. The cookie helps in reporting and personalization as well.

sa-user-id-v3.description: StackAdapt sets this cookie as a third party advertising cookie to record information about a user's website activity, such as the pages visited and the locations viewed, to enable us to provide users with interest-based content and personalised advertisements on external websites.

SEARCH_SAMESITE.description: These cookies are used to deliver adverts more relevant to you and your interests. They are also used to limit the number of times you see an advertisement as well as help measure the effectiveness of the advertising campaign. They are usually placed by advertising networks with the website operator's permission. They remember that you have visited a website and this information is shared with other organisations such as advertisers. Quite often targeting or advertising cookies will be linked to site functionality provided by the other organisation.

AMCV_14215E3D5995C57C0A495C55%40AdobeOrg.description: This is a pattern type cookie name associated with Adobe Marketing Cloud. It stores a unique visitor identifier, and uses an organisation identifier.

AMCVS_14215E3D5995C57C0A495C55%40AdobeOr.description: This is a pattern type cookie name associated with Adobe Marketing Cloud. It stores a unique visitor identifier, and uses an organisation identifier to allow a company to track users across their domains and services.

OGPC.description: Google sets this cookie to track user behavior and preferences across websites for targeted advertising purposes.

fbc.description: When a user clicks on an ad on Facebook, the link sometimes includes a fbclid query parameter. When the user lands on the target website, if the website has a Meta Pixel that uses first-party cookies, the Pixel automatically saves the fbclid query parameter to an _fbc cookie for that website domain.

SAPISID.description: SAPISID cookies are used by Google to display personalized advertisements on Google sites based on recent searches and previous interactions. They enable Google to collect user information for videos hosted by YouTube and other Google services.

__gads.description: This cookie is associated with the DoubleClick for Publishers service from Google. Its purpose is to do with the showing of adverts on the site, for which the owner may earn some revenue.

1P_JAR.description: This cookie carries out information about how the end user uses the website and any advertising that the end user may have seen before visiting the said website.

APISID.description: This DoubleClick cookie is generally set through the site by advertising partners, and used by them to build a profile of the website visitor's interests and show relevant ads on other sites. This cookie works by uniquely identifying your browser and device.

id.description: This cookie is set by DoubleClick (which is owned by Google) to build a profile of the website visitor's interests and show relevant ads on other sites.

IDE.description: Google DoubleClick IDE cookies store information about how the user uses the website to present them with relevant ads according to the user profile.

AEC.description: ‘AEC’ cookies ensure that requests within a browsing session are made by the user, and not by other sites. These cookies prevent malicious sites from acting on behalf of a user without that user’s knowledge.

NID.description: Used by Google to remember your preferences and other information, such as your preferred language.

SSID.description: SSID cookies are used to store a session identifier which the server uses to keep track of user activities across different pages. This can include items in a shopping cart, login status, or other session-related data.

uuid.description: This cookie is used to optimize ad relevance by collecting visitor data from multiple websites – this exchange of visitor data is normally provided by a third-party data-center or ad-exchange.

AID.description: used to link your activity across devices if you’ve previously signed in to your Google Account on another device. We do this to coordinate the ads you see across devices and measure conversion events. These cookies may be set on the domains google.com/ads, google.com/ads/measurement, or googleadservices.com.

ar_debug.description: Pinterst sets this cookie to collect information on user behaviour for identifying users from bots.

personalization_id.description: Unique value with which users can be identified by Twitter. Collected information is used to be personalize Twitter services, including Twitter trends, stories, ads and suggestions.

test_cookie.description: doubleclick.net sets this cookie to determine if the user's browser supports cookies.

MR.description: Analytics cookie that's used to pass user action information to the Bing advertising network.

MUID.description: Used widely by Microsoft as a unique user ID. This cookie enables tracking by synchronising the ID across many Microsoft domains.

_uetvid.description: This is a cookie utilised by Microsoft Bing Ads and is a tracking cookie. It allows us to engage with a user that has previously visited our website.

_evga_*.description: Stores personalization identities such as the anonymous ID or any persistent ID. Salesforce Interaction Studio Cookie used for tracking identity to build a common profile of the user.

ad-id.description: Used by Amazon Advertising to register user actions and target content on the website based on ad clicks on a different website.

ad-privacy.description: Used by Amazon Advertising to register user actions and target content on the website based on ad clicks on a different website.

_rdt_uuid.description: Reddit sets this cookie to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant ads.

_gcl_aw.description: Its purpose is primarily focused on keeping track of when a potential customer clicks upon an ad related to the website they’re currently accessing.

_gcl_gs.description: Its purpose is to track and attribute user conversions to specific Google Ads clicks. It helps in identifying which ads are driving actions like purchases or sign-ups, thereby measuring the effectiveness of advertising campaigns.

Conversion.description: Its purpose is to track and record conversions, such as purchases, form submissions, or other valuable actions taken by users on a website after interacting with a Google ad.

GCL_AW_P.description: Its purpose is to track and attribute conversions specifically to Google Ads campaigns, helping advertisers measure the performance of their ads by linking user actions on a website back to the ad clicks that initiated them.

_sfid_*.description: Stores any consents and their status provided to the Web SDK. Salesforce sets this cookie to manage session states and track user interactions with Salesforce applications.

MSPTC.description: Microsoft sets this cookie to track user behavior and personalize content across Microsoft platforms.

UserMatchHistory.description: LinkedIn sets this cookie to track user interaction with LinkedIn services and display relevant ads.

_rdt_em.description: Reddit sets this cookie to manage email subscriptions and track user interactions with marketing emails.

msclkid.description: Microsoft sets this cookie to track the performance of Microsoft advertising and measure the effectiveness of ad campaigns.

li_sugr.description: This cookie is used by LinkedIn for tracking the use of embedded services.

cky_preference_necessary_description: Necessary cookies are required to enable the basic features of this site, such as providing secure log-in or adjusting your consent preferences. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable data.
cky_preference_functional_description:
“Functional” cookies, sometimes called preference cookies, track and remember user's preferences and past choices on the website to provide a personalized user experience. For example, functional cookies can collect:​

  • Username.​

  • Password.​

  • Region.​

  • Language.
cky_preference_performance_description:
“Performance” cookies, sometimes called static cookies, collect information about the user's behavior on the website without collecting personal information, for example:​

  • Pages the user visits.​

  • Ads the user views.​

  • Ads or site features that the user clicks.
cky_preference_advertisement_description: Advertisement cookies are used to provide visitors with customized advertisements based on the pages you visited previously and to analyze the effectiveness of the ad campaigns.
